title: Çerezler ve Site Verileri İstisnalar
content: Tarayıcımın yalnızca istediğim sitelerden kalıcı çerezler tutmasını istiyorum. Bunun için Ayarlar > Gizlilik & Güvenlik > Firefox kapatıldığında çerezleri ve site verilerini sil - seçeneğini şaretleyip istisnalardan istediğim sitelere izin vererek kaydetmeme rağmen bazı sitelere yeniden kullanıcı ismi ve şifre ekranı ile otomatik doldurma ekranı çıkıyor. Bazı sitelerin sonuna "/" işareti, bazı sitelere "https" yerine "http", "www" ile başlamayan sitelerde "www" ekleyerek çeşitli kombinasyonlar deneyerek bunu yapabildim. Ama hala bazı siteler bu izinleri nedense dikkate almıyor ve dolayısıyla o siteler kapandığımda sitelerden bildirim alamıyorum. Bunu nasıl çözebilirim? Ayrıca sadece site linkine izin vermek neden yeterli olmuyorda, çeşitli denemeler yapmak zorunda kalıyorum?

title: Using Google tag manager in the site fails the page navigation in Firefox private browser
content:
I have implemented the Google tag manager in our website, because of which our site navigation(Including the anchor tag's) are not working in Firefox private window.

Disabling the Tracking protection and removing the google tag manager script fixes the issue. But, we need to use the Google tag manager in our website for our site.

Note: The site is working fine with Google tag manager & Tracking protection enabled in firefox normal window. Problem only arises in the private window.

Please let me know about this. Below is the firefox version which is used.

Firefox version: 91.0.2 (64-bit) OS : Windows 10 64-bit

title: Reactivate a support thread to correct an answer?
content:
A previous thread on the support website has an incorrect answer: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1288732

The responses may have been correct at the time, but there is an easy solution to this problem now. However, the thread has been archived so no new responses are allowed. The problem is a Google search (as well as other search engines and even a support.mozilla search) pops up this archived, incorrect response first. In some searches, a correct response cannot be found on the first page of search results.

It would be nice if there was a way to unarchive older questions to add a new answer to inaccurate or dated info.

title: New Business Ideas
content:
I am a loyal mozilla firefox user. I just want to give advice to mozilla, why not make a cloud business or server for the mozilla blog website business?.

I mean, like bloggers from google products, or wordpress and so on. Why not make it for mozilla, later it will sound cool "Mozilla Blog".

I will tell you a little, nowadays all technology is getting more sophisticated, where generally most people will look for information from a video, but there are still many who look for it from website sources, so, many people rely on their advertising through an "Ads". Many also become "Publishers" to earn economic income in this day and age, survey facts are increasing. But there are also many obstacles, especially regulations that are getting crazy from blog providers or advertising providers they work with.

For that why Mozilla does not just make a blog for all webmasters?. My advice is to make it, but it's different in terms of the ads itself, it will be more interesting and of course Mozilla will be more successful. believe me.

I give an example, create a cloud or server for a mozilla blog, when members or bloggers create a website they have a choice between free and premium. (it's mandatory). when they make an ad, they automatically become a "Mozilla Ads Publisher" and can immediately make money for them. This is the point, surely many will switch to Mozilla, I guarantee it.

For the difference between a free mozilla blog and a premium mozilla blog, you know, the order 1-10 or something like that belongs to the premium one and below it belongs to the free one, and there is also a calculation about CPM/CPC or CPA, which is of course bigger for the Premium blog. mozilla.

For the problem of income from advertising, he calls it "Mozilla Advertiser", I guarantee that there will be very many who want to work with mozilla ads, I guarantee that, given the uniqueness, ads will spread more quickly to existing webmasters because the regulations are not too strict will produce a boom. You just have to manage, the rules are minimal, minimal, but still for the clear and not cheating, that's all.


That's all my advice, considering technology is getting more advanced, why not just make it. The main key is: The more tightened the regulations, the more they will be abandoned.

If you need something for example about managing a blog server or blog cloud, I am ready to help. 

Thank you.

[Personal information removed by moderator. Please read Mozilla Support rules and guidelines, thanks.]

title: developer tools - blocked for x seconds
content:
Hi, I'm running out of google results regarding how to fix Firefox. I think now I'm making it even slower than it already is. What I did: - reinstalled 2 versions of FF (FF sre v78 latest, FF92 latest) (no plugins/extensions installed) - enabled/disabled DNS prefretch - enabled/disabled IPv6 - new profile created

Regardless of the above (and some other things) that I tried, in developer tools I see that each request is blocked for a couple of seconds. If a page has hundreds of requests, like amazon website, you can imagine that it takes minutes before the page completely loads.

In Safari on the other hand, the same website loads in a few seconds (bellow 8s lets say for amazon website).

Any idea how can I debug the issue?

Thanks

title: 403 error on xero.com login service
content:
I and some colleagues using firefox get a 403 error when switching to xero.com authorization services.

  • go.xero.com
  • my.xero.com
  • login.xero.com/identity/user/login

1) There is no error in other browsers and with postman. 2) On all versions of firefox, error 403. 3) When installing a clean isolated system on a virtual box - error 403. 4) The error occurs on any connected network. 5) WireShark showed packet loss: (on screenshot).

Technical features: 1) Windows XP (x32),Wwindows 10 (x64) 2) Firefox versions: 52.0-92.0 (latest)

P.S. Xero recommends that you contact you directly for assistance. Because not all users get this error under firefox.

title: Again, hiding the address bar ....
content:
I'm on MacOS. Firefox v92.0. I use Firefox only with three sites I use regularly. I want to maximise screen real estate by getting rid of the address bar. Getting rid of tabs too would be great, because I can use option-cmd-arrow to tab through them. And I can close the window from the menu. I tried to follow this post: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1288181 I did everything in that post, but the custom userChrome.css is having no effect. It's mentioned there that you have to use "window.open(...)" but I don't know what that means. The full screen function on MacOS is no good. It messes with my ability to swiftly switch between apps. So I cannot use it.

This is what I have in my userChrome.css file:

  1. main-window[chromehidden*="toolbar"] #nav-bar { 
 visibility: collapse;

}

/*** Tighten up drop-down/context/popup menu spacing (8 Sep 2021) ***/

menupopup:not(.in-menulist) > menuitem, menupopup:not(.in-menulist) > menu { 

 padding-block: 4px !important; /* reduce to 3px, 2px, 1px or 0px as needed */  min-height: unset !important; /* v92.0 - for padding below 4px */

}

root { 
 --arrowpanel-menuitem-padding: 4px 8px !important;

}
